settingsPane.description: Set Stweaks settings to be applyed on BOOT.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch, Load all settings from all TABS on boot, default is LOAD.
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot

button.description: Push to load all tuned settings if master switch is OFF or was OFF, if it was ON when phone booted then no need to push!! wait till you see that settings are loaded
button.name: LOAD ALL
button.label: LOAD ALL

settingsPane.description: The following settings are for all global CPU configuration, use it only if you know what you are doing.
settingsPane.name: CPU Global Settings

spinner.description: Maximum CPU-Speed for CPU0 and CPU1. CPU Frequency steps from 307.200 kHz to 1.593.600 kHz! (Default: 1.593.600 kHz)
spinner.name: Max Normal Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU-Speed for CPU2 and CPU3. CPU Frequency steps from 307.200 kHz to 2.150.400 kHz! (Default: 2.150.400 kHz)
spinner.name: Max Normal Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU-Speed for CPU0 and CPU1. CPU Frequency step from 307.200 kHz to 1.593.600 kHz! (Default: 307.200 kHz)
spinner.name: Min Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU-Speed for CPU2 and CPU3. CPU Frequency step from 307.200 kHz to 2.150.400 kHz! (Default: 307.200 kHz)
spinner.name: Min Frequency

settingsPane.description: Set CPU settings to save power.
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

checkbox.description: Only give sleepers 50% of their service deficit. This allows them to run sooner, but does not allow tons of sleepers to rip the spread apart.
checkbox.name: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: This driver monitors and manages system resources for better power efficiency. It keeps track of the current frequency of several resources (e.g. CPU and GPU) to manage other system resources (e.g. DDR frequency) more efficiently. (Default: On)
checkbox.name: MSM_POWER
checkbox.label: MSM_POWER

settingsPane.description: Set advanced governor settings. These settings are active only if the screen is on.
settingsPane.name: Governor Parameters tuning

spinner.description: This will set the CPU0 and CPU1 governors. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications. (Default: SchedUtil)
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU2 and CPU3 governors. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications. (Default: SchedUtil)
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

button.description: Use this button to push all new changes to the governor in real time!
button.name: GOV Policy Install
button.label: Apply settings to GOV core

settingsPane.description: Global governor Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: GLOBAL GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Measured as percentage, when load on CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) is equal to above up threshold, CPU is scaled Up. Lower value - early scale up, and vice-verse. (Only for Ondemand, Conservative). (Default: 80%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_01

seekBar.description: Measured as percentage, when load on CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) is equal to above up threshold, CPU is scaled Up. Lower value - early scale up, and vice-verse. (Only for Ondemand, Conservative). (Default: 80%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_23

seekBar.description: Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for OnDemand, Conservative). (Default: 20.000 µs)
seekBar.name: sampling_rate_01

seekBar.description: Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for OnDemand, Conservative). (Default: 20.000 µs)
seekBar.name: sampling_rate_23

seekBar.description: Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for Interactive, Nightmare, Darkness, Alucard). (Default: 20.000 µs)
seekBar.name: timer_rate_01

seekBar.description: Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for Interactive, Nightmare, Darkness, Alucard). (Default: 20.000 µs)
seekBar.name: timer_rate_23

seekBar.description: Up Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: 1.000 µs)
seekBar.name: up_rate_limit_us_01

seekBar.description: Up Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: 2.000 µs)
seekBar.name: up_rate_limit_us_23

seekBar.description: Down Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: 6.000 µs)
seekBar.name: down_rate_limit_us_01

seekBar.description: Down Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: 6.000 µs)
seekBar.name: down_rate_limit_us_23

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). Setting to 1 makes no difference and causes CPU to immediately scale down from highest frequency. Sampling down factor is NOT valid for lower frequencies and low load conditions. Note that CPU is scaled up to max frequency when max_load_freq is greater than up_threshold X current frequency. (or to cur_freq + (freq_step X policy.max_freq) whichever is smaller) Max_load_freq is an arbitrary frequency calculated as the maximum of load_frequencies. (Only for Ondemand, Conservartive). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_factor_01

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). Setting to 1 makes no difference and causes CPU to immediately scale down from highest frequency. Sampling down factor is NOT valid for lower frequencies and low load conditions. Note that CPU is scaled up to max frequency when max_load_freq is greater than up_threshold X current frequency. (or to cur_freq + (freq_step X policy.max_freq) whichever is smaller) Max_load_freq is an arbitrary frequency calculated as the maximum of load_frequencies. (Only for Ondemand, Conservartive) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_factor_23

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency each time CPU load reaches up_threshold or target_cpu_load. (Only for Ondemand, Nightmare, Conservative). (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_01

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency each time CPU load reaches up_threshold or target_cpu_load. (Only for Ondemand, Nightmare, Conservative). (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_23

spinner.description: Until freq_for_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is up_threshold_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_for_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_for_responsiveness. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 422.400 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_for_responsiveness_01

spinner.description: Until freq_for_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is up_threshold_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_for_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_for_responsiveness. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 403.200 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_for_responsiveness_23

seekBar.description: This is same as the up_threshold found for the Ondemand governor but for the opposite direction. For example when set to its default value of 20 it means that if the CPUCPU(CPU0 or CPU1) usage needs to be below 20% between samples to have the frequency decreased. (Only for Conservative). (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_01

seekBar.description: This is same as the up_threshold found for the Ondemand governor but for the opposite direction. For example when set to its default value of 20 it means that if the CPUCPU(CPU2 or CPU3) usage needs to be below 20% between samples to have the frequency decreased. (Only for Conservative). (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_23

settingsPane.description: Nightmare, Darkness and Alucard governor Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: NIGHTMARE | DARKNESS | ALUCARD GOV CONFIGURATON

spinner.description: When current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max, freq_step_dec will be equal to freq_step_dec_at_max_freq. (CPU0 or CPU1 only for Nightmare). (Default: 1.593.600 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_for_responsiveness_max_01

spinner.description: When current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max, freq_step_dec will be equal to freq_step_dec_at_max_freq. (CPU2 or CPU3 only for Nightmare). (Default: 2.150.400 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_for_responsiveness_max_23

spinner.description: Until freq_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is target_cpu_load. Also during the part where CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_responsiveness. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: 1.113.600 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_responsiveness_01

spinner.description: Until freq_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is target_cpu_load. Also during the part where CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_responsiveness. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: 1.113.600 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_responsiveness_23

spinner.description: Until freq_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is target_cpu_load. Also during the part where CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) greater than freq_responsiveness_max b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_responsiveness_max. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1.324.800 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_responsiveness_max_01

spinner.description: Until freq_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is target_cpu_load. Also during the part where CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) greater than freq_responsiveness_max b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_responsiveness_max. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1.920.000 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_responsiveness_max_23

spinner.description: Jump directly to frequency responsiveness value when CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency is going to increase and it will be lower than it. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: Off)
spinner.name: freq_responsiveness_jump_01

spinner.description: Jump directly to frequency responsiveness value when CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency is going to increase and it will be lower than it. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness). (Default: Off)
spinner.name: freq_responsiveness_jump_23

spinner.description: Do not reduce the frequency if the CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) has not been idle recently, as the reduction is likely to be premature then. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness, SchedUtil). (Default: Off)
spinner.name: eval_busy_for_freq_01

spinner.description: Do not reduce the frequency if the CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) has not been idle recently, as the reduction is likely to be premature then. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness, SchedUtil). (Default: Off)
spinner.name: eval_busy_for_freq_23

spinner.description: This is a flag that determines if waiting for various IO should increase the CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) utilization in bump up the cpu frequency. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness, SchedUtil). (Default: Off)
spinner.name: iowait_boost_enable_01

spinner.description: This is a flag that determines if waiting for various IO should increase the CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) utilization in bump up the cpu frequency. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness, SchedUtil). (Default: Off)
spinner.name: iowait_boost_enable_23

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU0 and CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_at_min_freq_01

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU2 and CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_at_min_freq_23

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU0 and CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_01

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU2 and CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_23

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU0 and CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load is below target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_at_min_freq_01

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU2 and CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load is below target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_at_min_freq_23

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU0 and CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_01

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU2 and CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard, SchedAlucard). (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_23

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for nightmare). (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_at_min_freq_01

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load. (Only for nightmare). (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_at_min_freq_23

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal target_cpu_load. (CPU0 or CPU1 only for Nightmare). (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_at_min_freq_01

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal target_cpu_load. (CPU2 or CPU3 only for Nightmare). (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_at_min_freq_23

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal target_cpu_load. (CPU0 or CPU1 only for Nightmare). (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_01

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal target_cpu_load. (CPU2 or CPU3 only for Nightmare). (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_23

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) load reaches target_cpu_load. Only for Nightmare). Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_01

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) load reaches target_cpu_load. Only for Nightmare). Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_23

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load and current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_at_max_freq_01

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency each time CPU load reaches target_cpu_load and current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_at_max_freq_23

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpus frequency scaling up when current cpu(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness_max. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_up_rate_at_max_freq_01

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpus frequency scaling up when current cpu(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness_max. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: cpus_up_rate_at_max_freq_23

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpus frequency scaling up when current cpu(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_up_rate_01

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpus frequency scaling up when current cpu(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_up_rate_23

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu frequency scaling down when current cpu(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness_max. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_down_rate_at_max_freq_01

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu frequency scaling down when current cpu(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness_max. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_down_rate_at_max_freq_23

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu frequency scaling down when current cpu(CPU0 or CPU1) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_down_rate_01

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu frequency scaling down when current cpu(CPU2 or CPU3) frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_down_rate_23

spinner.description: Load(CPU0 and CPU1) calculation for increasing and decresing frequency. (Only for Alucard, Darkness, Nightmare). (Default: Average Load)
spinner.name: load_mode_01

spinner.description: Load(CPU2 and CPU3) calculation for increasing and decresing frequency. (Only for Alucard, Darkness, Nightmare). (Default: Average Load)
spinner.name: load_mode_23

settingsPane.description: Use cpu capacity governor settings. These settings are active only if the screen is on. (Only for SchedAlucard, SchedDarkness)
settingsPane.name: CPU-Capacity Governor Parameters tuning

button.description: Use this button to push all new changes to the governor in real time!
button.name: CPU-CAPACITY GOV Policy Install
button.label: Apply cpu-capacity settings to GOV core

settingsPane.description: Here you can select the GPU Governor, set Min and Max GPU frequency.
settingsPane.name: GPU Governors and settings

spinner.description: Select GPU Governor that will control GPU frequency according to GPU load and system needs - if you select Performance Governor, then the GPU will be at MAX frequency nonstop!
spinner.name: GPU Active Governor

spinner.description: Select GPU Max frequency when needed! GPU will stay at MIN frequency on IDLE.
spinner.name: GPU Max Speed

spinner.description: Select GPU Min frequency when going to IDLE - if you set higher than 133 MHz, then the GPU will hold selected frequency on IDLE.
spinner.name: GPU Min Speed

settingsPane.description: Tune IO settings managed by Kernel
settingsPane.name: IO Tuning

seekBar.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for INTERNAL SDCARD! file systems on this device. (Default: 512 kB)
seekBar.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

spinner.description: This will set the default IO scheduler for internal sdcard. (Default: CFQ)
spinner.name: Default IO Scheduler Int.

settingsPane.description: Tune memory and OOM (low mem management) settings managed by Kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

spinner.description: Here you can set the low memory reserve ratio, higher ratio give you more free RAM if you see that your free RAM is always loaded and device LAG, but it also uses more battery to gain more free RAM with loaded system. use relaxed ONLY if your free RAM is above 650MB always! if less than 280MB use recommended or high pressure.
spinner.name: Low Memory Reserve

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

settingsPane.description: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) uses a network congestion-avoidance algorithm that includes various aspects of an additive increase|multiplicative decrease (AIMD) scheme, with other schemes such as slow-start to achieve congestion avoidance. The TCP congestion-avoidance algorithm is the primary basis for congestion control in the Internet.
settingsPane.name: TCP Congestion control tweaks

spinner.description: Set TCP algorithm. (Default: CUBIC)
spinner.name: tcp_congestion_control

settingsPane.description: Set some settings and options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to see current SELINUX status! ON or OFF globaly. default is OFF, you can turn it ON with button below.
button.name: SELINUX STATUS CHECK
button.label: SELINUX STATUS CHECK

spinner.description: Allows you to change your SELinux (Security-Enhanced Linux) Status from Enforcing (policy is enforced) to Permissive (prints warnings instead of enforcing).
spinner.name: SeLinux Control

settingsPane.description: Set GPS and NTP settings and options.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot. Many new ROMS are running the init.d scripts automatically. You can also force running the scripts, but if you run them and ROM runs them too, we have a problem: all scripts are running X2 times! To avoid conflicts, Stweaks RUN-control is disabled by default. If you know that your ROM is NOT supporting init.d script running, then turn it ON here and reboot.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

settingsPane.description: General tweaks
settingsPane.name: General tweaks

button.description: Use this button to Trim System, Data and Cache Nand partitions to speed up Read and Write Access, good to use once in a day or two.
button.name: Trim System, Data and Cache
button.label: Trim NOW

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen STweaks profile + settings and on screen state (ON or OFF) and we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings, after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable the background-process from CortexBrain. Disabling it means, losing the functions that sets different settings for screen state (ON/OFF).
spinner.name: CortexBrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the CortexBrain-Background-Process is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

settingsPane.description: You can check which profile is used.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Select profile. You can also switch the default profiles (battery, default, performance) via Kernel-Recovery.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles

settingsPane.description: Backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. When you restore your configuration, please wait till this app restarts with the new settings. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait here!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup or Restore
